Art. 4.250. 
Information 
The draft agreement is communicated to each of the parties by the executing notary.
At the same time, the executing notary fixes a meeting at which the content of the agreement and its consequences are explained to all the parties.
On this occasion, he informs each of them of the possibility of choosing a separate adviser or of having an individual meeting with him. He will reiterate this possibility during the joint meeting that he is to hold.
This meeting may not be held before a period of fifteen days has elapsed from the date of communication of the draft agreement.   
The information meeting may be held remotely using an electronic means of communication enabling all the parties to the agreement, as well as those assisting or advising them, to participate simultaneously in the information meeting throughout its duration.
